1.text: Wash the orange before you slice it.

2.text: Slice the ends off the orange.
2.vid: /6/63/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 2 Version 3.360p.mp4

3.text: Cut the orange down the middle vertically.

4.text: Make 3 even diagonal cuts to cut each half into 3 wedges.
4.vid: /5/5d/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 4 Version 3.360p.mp4

5.text: Slice a notch from the flesh to the peel in the middle of each wedge.
5.vid: /3/3c/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 5 Version 3.360p.mp4

6.text: Stick the wedges on the rims of drink glasses to garnish them.
6.vid: /b/bd/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 6 Version 3.360p.mp4

7.text: Cut both ends off your orange.
7.vid: /0/0f/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 7 Version 3.360p.mp4

8.text: Slice the orange into round slabs of the desired thickness, starting at one end.
8.vid: /a/a0/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 8 Version 3.360p.mp4

9.text: Cut each wheel in half if you want orange slices for your drinks.
9.vid: /a/ad/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 9 Version 3.360p.mp4

10.text: Slice a notch into your wheels or slices if you want to put them on glasses.
10.vid: /a/a1/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 10 Version 3.360p.mp4

11.text: Stick your wheels and wedges onto glasses or into glasses or pitchers.

12.text: Cut the bottom off an orange and place it cut-side-down on a cutting board.
12.vid: /6/65/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 12 Version 3.360p.mp4

13.text: Use a paring knife to slice off a thin oval of the orange’s peel.
13.vid: /e/e0/Cut an Orange for Drinks Step 13 Version 3.360p.mp4

14.text: Twist the ends of the piece of peel in opposite directions using your fingertips.

15.text: Put the orange twist into a cocktail and serve the drink.
